page.title: 01The W Coast of Seil Island
page.content: A typical narrow road climbs in the NE corner small sheep and cattle farms and holiday cottages the only habitation. The coast reveals the Atlantic Ocean breaking heavily on a rocky coast merging into a strip of rough grass and bracken soon turning up to 80-100 metre hills. Descend past an old iron milepost. By the shore, two modernised semi-detached, wooden clad local authority houses with lobster pots indicating a fishing industry. Varied bird life and much washed up rubbish are evident. 1.5k West on the tip of Easdale Island are an award winning slate quarry museum and workers cottages, now holiday homes. The extreme SE corner on Seil is the only woodland area. West from here, again farms and cottages and a regular car ferry taking mainly holiday visitors to living where Cuam
